reviews.review:
Bioshock Infinite is absolutely amazing, the shere attention to detail and the gripping story made all the time spent looking in every corner of every random lane and fighting wave after wave of interesting (but occaisionally dull) enemies a blast and had justified the 20+ hours I have spent on this game.

 I found the story in the beginning a bit slow and uneventful, but the bright and glamorous world made up for that with interesting dialogue, spoken by the people lining the streets and the great showcase of the indoctrination of the people by Father Comstock. As the story/game progresses things change dramatically, throwing in plenty of combat and spicing up the story perfectly.

After ruthlessly slaughtering countless numbers of enemies I found the combat got a bit dull, and in a way a bit easy after getting most of the upgrades and new weapons/vigors. The enemies are also a bit on the bland side, since most of them are just a darkish colour and little detail on the uniforms I found my self killing what I thought was the same person over and over again, this was especially prevalent towards the end of the game.

The combat incorperates a lot of 'fantasy' into it, with things like Vigors and more modern guns with a little less realism and less punch. The physics of the weapons felt great too, they were not way too unrealistic but they weren't too reaslistic either, which provided a nice blend making those heads look as bigger target as always. If I were to have 1 major complaint about the guns it would be how underpowered some guns can be towards the end of the game, where I ran out of ammo for  my sniper and had only a pistol as a replacement. The pistol been my main weapon at the beginning of the game and could take down enemies in what felt like 1 blow, but the pistol had no such effect when taking down the same enemies later on, making one have to completely spray all their ammo at the opponents head to actually take them down.

At the end of the story things get very weird and confusing but when the game ends, most previous events in the game begin to come together, but some do not leading to a lot of confusion and possibly sequels (?). The end left me wanting to play again, so that I can find all those little events that link to the main plot and then giggle, thinking about "how could I have not noticed this before?"

This game is one of a small ammount of games that have left me happy and satisfied at the end, and I can definately see myself playing it again sometime in the future. To get a game this great for only $10 was itself amazing. I have seen games that cost a lot more and has been realeased a lot earlier, that are absolutely terrible. 

Overall I believe Bioshock Infinite to be well worth the time and money, and that Irration games & 2K have done an exellent job, creating what is probably, a masterpiece. 
I would definately recommend getting this game, and I guarantee (A guarantee? Who has time for all that paperwork?)  you will have fun! 
 I give it a 10/10

Utterly confused in the first 10-20 minutes of this game. Seemed to be just mindless moving and shooting but this game is absolutely stunning. After a while when you get to grips with gameplay and start discovering the storyline it's truly incredible. Loving this game right now

Je vous conseille fortement d'attendre les soldes parcequ'il est définitivement à faire mais quelle déception !!!  :(

C'est beau, le scenar global est plutôt sympa même si au bout d'un moment on comprend plus grand chose, enfin pour ma part. 

Le Gameplay est très bon, le coup de l'aerotram est vraiment bien pensé et agréable à jouer.

Après, On nous colle toute une partie qui ne rime pas à grand chose et qui semble avoir été raccrochée au scenar à l'arrache. On y frise le ridicule quand pour récupérer le Zeppelin qui nous a été volé, on doit attaquer un Zeppelin, dézinguer tout l'équipage et....  s'enfuir avec ? Bah non, on va détruire le moteur O_O wtf !!!  

Fouiller un peu pour trouver de l'argent et autre Ok mais là on se demande presque si on ne joue pas à éboueur Simulator tellement on passe le plus clair de son temps à appuyer sur F pour fouiller  les poubelles, les coffres, les cadavres, bref si la révolution du FPS c'est de passer son temps à chercher des pièces et ramasser des pommes ... autant se faire un RPG.

Les ennemis sont juste stupides, pas plus pas moins. 

Les compteurs de certains trophées qui marchent un peu quand ils veulent et on touche le fond avec les DLC qui boostent les armes et facilitent le jeu pour 25€ de plus O_O , 20 € le SP et 5€ un DLC pour commencer avec des pièces et booster une ou deux armes bref j'ai quand même l'impression qu'on me prend pour une truffe.

Un portage PC plus que limite avec certaines commandes vraiment mal pensées ( appuyer sur Enter c'est quand même pas très pratique ), cerise sur le gâteau il manque des informations sur les contrôles : 
"Vous pouvez gérer vos équipements dans le menu de jeu" Ok parfait, seulement pour le trouver le menu de jeu .... Soit vous le cherchez en appuyant sur toutes les touches ou plus simple, vous demandez à Google. ( touche : o [AU] )

Vous aurez compris, je vous déconseille fortement d'acheter le jeu au tarif plein sous peine d'être encore plus déçu que je ne le suis. 

Vous passerez un moment agréable à faire le jeu et un moment encore plus agréable à le désinstaller.

Bon jeu à tous
A fun game, I wish you could customize your character more, but overall a great experience.
what is freedom?

I gotta be honest, I wasn't really a big fan of the first and second Bioshock. When I got this one, I expected far less than what I actually got. This game is by far, the best Bioshock game ever. Words cannot explain how much I loved playing this game.

The game looks great, has a nice atmosphere, amazing art direction, really likeable sidekick, fluid gunplay, very good voice acting and touches on themes you don't normally see in video games. Sadly, the game falls flat on his face in every other category. The two-weapon limit is beyond retarded for this kind of game and renders the upgrade system almost completely useless. Most vigors are useless as well, and many enemies are just horrible bullet sponges if you play on Hard. The worst offender is the story. It starts out promising, and then the themes like American Exceptionalism and Mainfest Destiny are completely discarded for a hackneyed time-travel-plot that doesn't make a lick of sense no matter how you look at it and tries to fool the player into thinking that it's deep. Also, the game has to have the worst ending since Mass Effect 3. Play the original Bioshock instead.

What can I say about Bioshock Infinite, It is not based in rapture and it has no big daddy's or little sisters.
It has a new character with a name and is not anything to do with any of the other Bioshocks.
So what I say about this game in particular is that is a great game even thought it takes place in the sky and has no connection to rapture it is an amazing game in general.

An outstanding game, and a even better storyline. The game might be boring at first but once things start to come together this game is amazing. I have played through it 3 times and Its still a great game! I highly recommend this game! There is more postive than negitive ignore all the dislike trolls, this game is worth the price!

Это что то нереально крутое!Мне от восторга в голову всякие ругательства лезут,которые я не могу тут написать!)Итак,назвать это игрой я не могу,я могу смело заявить что это настоящее произведение исскуства.От одного сюжета можно смело говорить насколько всё круто и интересно придумали разработчики.Сказать по правде,я после прохождения некоторые моменты сюжета не понял....после я начал искать с выпученными глазами инфу про эту игру и сюжет..мне было аж жарко от эмоций которые я получил, дойдя до концовки.Перечеслять плюсы у меня займёт наверно неделю)С удовольствием перепрохожу и буду надеется что со временем буду забывать,чтобы снова поиграть,но боюсь от такой игры я никогда не забуду!!!Буду ждать с нетерпением продолжение,выхода книги или фильма,если такое будет возможно.Вообщем народ:советую даже не задумаваться....берите и проходите....не пожалеете!!!
Best game i have ever played !! 9.5/10

I was so excited when this finally came out for the Mac. I'm really limited to what games I can play on the system, so I was overjoyed when they released the Mac version.
I adore how the game gives you a slight false sense of security in the way the environment looks. It feels so beautiful like some kind of artwork in a museum, but then theres all this filth everywhere and blood and racisim (not for the super faint at heart!!) and the marriage between the two is wonderful. 
One of my favourite things in this game is the range of weapons to choose from. Not only can you use melee and a gun, but there are so many guns to choose from it's a shame you can only carry two at a time. 
//SPOILERS//
The way Elizabeth changes through the game was an amazong touch. Her outfits, leading up to the DLC part one are increasingly less innocent and it's interesting how the designers showed her progression in that way. 
//END OF SPOILERS//
The only complaint I have is that they haven't made the first Bioshock for Mac yet

ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ 10/10, А КОНЦОВКА ШЕДЕВР!!!

Un juego que abandona sus fueros y se adapta a las nuevas generaciones de gamers. Si esperas encontrar la dificultad de los anteriores Bioshock ya puedes ir buscándote otro juego: Es fácil. Y eso si lo juegas en difícultad difícil. Puedes desbloquear modos de dificultad más para "hombres" una vez finalizas el juego, pero Infinite tiene la característica de que no te apetece repetirlo al menos hasta pasado un tiempo.

El juego incorpora enemigos predecibles y algo escasos de inteligencia colectiva, que se repiten hasta la saciedad incluso en bandos distintos que son los mismos soldados pero de otro color y con algo de mal gusto para elegir su catálogo de armas, las cuales, si bien son variadas, están tan desequilibradas que siempre irás con las mismas. Y no te preocupes que no te quedarás sin munición en ningún momento, hay máquinas expendedoras en todas partes. ¿Qué estás en un globo? Máquina expendedora. ¿Bajo tierra? Máquina expendedora. ¿En el lavabo? máquina expendedora. Y si ves que no hay máquina expendedora no te preocupes, hay mujer expendedora. Porque ahora ya no vas solo, una agraciada e inmortal muchacha te acompaña a todos lados equipada con el bolsillo de Doraemon, pues cada medio minuto oirás un "DeWitt, catch!" et voilá, tendremos un montón de balas, monedas, salud etc... de nuevo. Hasta el Big Daddy del DLC es un mal chiste comparado con los del Bioshock original. Se comenta por el pinganillo que si lo pones en dificultad normal y te matan viene un técnico de Steam y te borra la cuenta para que no te acerques más a un videojuego.

Lo positivo del juego es que aporta una historia bastante interesante y bien planteada, con pocos fallos y muy absorbente que termina en un final simplemente apoteósico. De los mejores finales de videojuego que puedes encontrarte hoy en día. Por desgracia la disfrutarás poco pues el juego dura aproximadamente cuatro horas sin morir, es decir, en nivel difícil. En detalles menores destacar un apartado gráfico impecable y vistoso, buenas físicas y buen apartado sonoro, que hacen que el juego entre por los ojos y te olvides temporalmente de esa maravilla de I.A.

En resumen: Buen juego y buena vuelta de tuerca a la saga de Bioshock, ahora apta para jugadores menos amantes de los juegos duros, si bien podrían haber hecho algo más con esa I.A. tan nefasta. Si te gustan los Bioshock o los Shooter en general y piensas que una grandiosa historia puede camuflar una dificultad para novatos, no dudes en adquirirlo.
Nota: 8,5/10.

Trust the Crust: Bioshock Infinite
yes bioshock infinite the game that has been getting all kinds of hype and good ratings, but is it really that good well i'm here to say sort of. First of you are in a story unrelated to the other bioshocks so don't worry if you didn't play these in this story you are sent to Columbia a floating city in the sky to find a girl to repay a dept. You find the girl and she becomes your AI companion but don't worry she cant be harmed and follows you without your doing anything she also finds health, ammo, and money which she gives you when you need it. Now i'm going to stop talking about the story because its super complicated and the ending doesnt really makes sense to me so lets talk game play. You of course have a good variety of guns machine guns grenade launchers and different versions of all of them the one downside is you can only carry two of them unlike previous bioshock where you carried all your guns and had three ammo types for each. You also have powers known as vigors which there are 8 of ranging from shooting lighting, fire and crows to absorbing enemy shots and turning enemies friendly. All the shooting and powers plays well and feels good all the powers feel useful and are handy for different situations. The two other things at your disposal in combat are you sky hook which lets you jump onto railings and zip around making you harder to hit and getting places much faster, and your companions power to materialize random preset objects such as turrets and cover. all these elements make the combat feel fun and fast pace but crusty what about the enemies well they are mostly just guys with guns there are some melee based ones and robots ong with a teleporty guy and the game has a few enemies that are only in brief parts of the game which i thought was gay i think they should have somehow made different combos of all the types to make situations more challenging but they didn't so whatever. Now bioshock also has upgrades and equipment. The upgrades are lame and you simply purchase them with money which you scavenge from the world and you have to buy every guns upgrade individually which is retarded like say you upgrade the machine gun but run out of ammo and switch it for one of the other four assault rifles they will be shit because they still need upgrades and you dont earn nearly enough money in the game to even come close to fully upgrading everything. The game is rather linear i mean you can explore to a degree like if your in a building you can check every room but if your for supplies but that's about all it adds to. The game also isn't that challenging except for some key parts, you will never need to purchase health or salts for your powers because there are a million items scattered in the world that refill them. The one thing i will say i really liked was the game has a lot of moments that you can just walk around and not worry about getting shot its a much more calm game then the previous bioshcok that was more dark and always had you being careful with you resources which i liked but at least this game isn't just a replica it is different and that's a good thing. Overall the game is fun and the story is enjoyable with some interesting characters, the combat is smooth and the enemies arnt stupid just not as tough as you might want, It looks nice and is a decent length all things considered and if you can get past the very questionable endings its a great experience and defiantly the best game to come out so far this year, right i'm talking about you dead space and gears you shits.

This is one of the best games I've ever played. Visuals are beautiful, and the gameplay is smooth. There are plenty of weapons, infusions, and vigors to keep the game fresh and exciting. The story line is very well written and detailed, as well as compelling, although rather confusing if you don't pay attention.

Gameplay is very streamlined, and feels as unique and fresh as the original, and creates the perfect mix of action and story driven gameplay. There are many ways to play this game, and if you utilize all the features properly you'll find yourself ripping through enemies, with combat still being challenging and intense. Combat is extremely gratifying, and hardly ever feels forced or repetitive. Level design and  atmosphere of this game provides a beautiful and immersive environment that both keeps you on edge, and encourages you to sight-see. 

The story of this game is a masterpiece. This game's characters seem to be real people. They are very believable, and are remarkable at creating emotional attachment. Voice acting and dialog is executed perfectly in this game. The plot is very interesting and complex, leaving you excited to find out what comes next in your character's journey, and how it will play out for your companion. This games conclusion is unexpected, and satisfying, while leaving you trying to comprehend everything surrounding it. Replaying it will reveal many unnoticed or overlooked details of the plot as well.

As of now I would call this game the best I've ever played. I highly recommend buying it.

The combat was attrious. The graphics and world building barely managed to drag me along but when the story did not pay off in the end I was extremely disppointed that I played this game.

Don't buy this go buy the original Bioshock instead and I guarantee you will have way more fun.

I hate baby mode games that are so easy there is no point in playing them. Developers please offer harder challenges from the start. Don't take away the customization or over-simplify the gameplay making it so a r-e-t-a-r-d-e-d four year could beat the game barely trying. If I wanted to watch a movie then I would watch a movie. Don't be like Metal Gear Solid or FFXIII and ruin the fun for people that play games for the gameplay.

Самая замечательная игра из всех, что я видел. Особенно поражает место действия, город в небе, каждый дом тщательно прорисован, в каждой комнате детализация вещей - от рисунка на обоях до мусора на полу. Красивые виды. Элизабет тоже симпатичная, много разговоров между ней и Букером. Сам сюжет тоже интересный, фантастические переходы в параллельные вселенные. Есть, правда, вопросы: когда мы переходим в другую Колумбию, где Букер погиб, где тамошняя Элизабет? Почему солдаты и полицейские не используют против Букера энергетики, которые продаются свободно? Я прошел эту игру уже 6 раз, и наверное буду еще играть (2 голософона где-то не нашел). А хотелось бы, чтобы разработчики сделали просто свободный режим (как в GTA San Andreas), чтобы можно было просто гулять по городу, зайти туда, куда по ходу игры не дают зайти.

I bought this game quite a while ago, and the fact that I still enjoy it to hell even now should say a lot.

Many of the negative responses I see when I look on this section get angry because this game is not "similar enough" to Bioshocks 1 &2. Thanks for pointing out the obvious guys. This game is nothing like the first 2 at all really. It's an entirely new beast altogether. Evidence: 1 & 2 are set in a dreary, enclosed, underwater dystopia whereas Infinite is set in the sky, in what is (initially) a happy "American dream". Things really don't get more opposite than that.

The differences don't end there though. Plasmids (or Vigors as they're called here) return, but are generally different to their Rapture counterparts. Guns too hae recieved an overhaul, though not always for the better. Whereas in Rapture you fought with cobbled together harpoon guns and tin-can grenade launchers, here you have access to accurate, reliable (though fairly generic) military grade guns... 1910-20's era generally, but still actualy manufactured guns. You can only carry two though, which is a bit of a letdown.

Also different is the general style of game. Where 1 and 2 were a blend of action, survival and horror, this game focuses on the action primarily. This new emphasis has, in my opinion, massively improved the combat, though I find it a bit more... generic than the others, It's smoother, but it's changed from quirkily poor to just average. The exception is the Sky-line system, which is a real game changer and a lot of fun to use.
------------

The game also boasts some of the best characterisation I've ever seen in a video game. Elizabeth. the other main character. is one of the best female characters i've personally seen, and pretty useful too. Booker also is well developed and likeable (or iritable) enough to keep me interested. Other characters fall short of this, but they only play a minor part in the story and are fleshed out through the traditional audio-diaries.

The story itself is very, very bold. I personally think it's brilliant, as it actually forces the player to think about things, which may happen later or already have. At the end looking back I realised just how much my mind had been blown away by the whole experiance. All i'll asy about it hear though, is that it's complex. and don't hurt your brain thinking about it too hard at the end.
--------------------

Overall, this has been one of if not my favourite game that has come out in the past 3 or so years. However, if you're looking for another Bioshock 1/2, or only care about the gameplay and combat, then you won't enjoy this. For most people though, I reckon you're gonna love it.

Excelente juego, se nota el mimo que tuvieron en cuanto a los detalles, un diseño visual excelente que combina elementos futuristas con entornos propios de la decada de los 20's y 30's y que aprovechando la potencia del motor grafico en el cual fue desarrollado luce en todo momento. Asimismo su ambientacion sonora se compone de piezas que van desde finales del siglo XIX hasta bien entrados en la mitad del siglo XX, piezas que encajan con la estetica del juego de una forma muy natural.
El diseño de personajes es muy bueno si hablamos de los protagonistas o de personajes clave siendo Elizabeth la que mejor diseño lleva y en la que se nota hubo mas tiempo invertido; mas sin embargo los personajes genericos que encontramos a lo largo del juego tienen diseños faciales muy repetidos lo cual rompe un poco la 'ilusion de inmersión' que se genera con los otros puntos antes mencionados.
En cuanto a la historia, simplemente sublime, todo al principio puede parecer confuso pero a medida que vamos avanzando las piezas comienzan a encajar... y de una forma en la que no nos lo esperariamos, uno de los mejores usos de la mecanica cuantica como base de la trama de un juego, mas exactamente de los viajes en el tiempo, las paradojas, los multiversos y la teoria de cuerdas; aun asi se ven cosas como la lucha de clases, la sublevacion de los oprimidos, el fanatismo religioso entre otros temas que aparentan ser el eje del juego pero en realidad no lo son del todo(no digo mas para no spoilear) y el final, definitivamente pone a pensar y da para multiples interpretaciones...a gusto del consumidor :D .
El sistema de juego si bien es sencillo nos presta el uso de los vigorizadores para realizar diferentes combinaciones que nos brinden alguna ventaja, pudo se algo mejor pero de por si es muy bueno.
La IA te embosca, se cubren y trata de ponertelo no tan facil pero a veces solo corren hacia ti para que los mates XD, definitivamente esta pudo ser mejor. Por otro lado la IA de Elizabeth si que esta muy bien trabajada y en ningun momento ella supone una carga, todo lo contrario, de hecho es un personaje que genera bastante empatia.

A mi me dio para 17 horas en la primera partida jugandolo en dificil y con un control de ps2 (para que me durara mas el juego jajaja) recorriendolo lentamente, explorando (hay muchos voxafonos a lo largo del juego que basicamente son grabaciones que desvelan mas detalles de la historia) y contemplando el paisaje. Uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado hasta la fecha y que sinceramente consideraria se acerca mas al concepto de arte que de videojuego (con 27 años y jugando desde los 8 actualmente es muy dificil sorprenderme hasta ese nivel).

graficos : 9.5/10 (las caras genericas le quitan unos puntos)
historia; 10/10 
jugabilidad: 9/10 (pudo ser mejor)
banda sonora: 10/10 (muy bien elegida, te hace sentir como si en verdad estuvieras a principios del siglo XX)
IA: 8.5 (si bien llega a  ser dificil a veces. Que corran hacia su 'muerte' no es muy realista y le quita puntos) 

se pueden comentar mas cosas pero me ya me he excedido un poco...jejeje, MUY recomendado.
Best FPS Ever.

This game is great!  The story, the gameplay, and the graphics make this game one of my favorites.  I'm pretty picky when it comes to games so this is really saying a lot.  When I finished the game the first time I was devistated because it was over, but at the same time my jaw dropped to the floor because of how the game ended.  If you haven't played it then you are definitely missing out on one of the best games of this generation.

If you're looking for a game like the first 2 bioshocks, this isn't for you. However, the gameplay was enjoyable and fun. The graphic are great, and Elizabeth isn't any damsel in distress. She can take care of herself and she can even assist you during the game.

10/10
Loved it.
Es el mejor juego de la saga despues del primer bioshock

One of my most favorite games! I cannot begin to describe how amazing this game was. Definitely one to remember for a long time. I won't go much into detail since I don't wanna spoil anything, but get your hands on this bad baby and take yourself for a ride that ends in mind f-u-c-k! This is most certainly one of those games that has a powerful emotional grip on you and doesn't let go for a while.

This might be the best game I've ever played story-wise.  The only two criticisms I had was that 1) it had too many interruptions to the story for shooting (yes it's an FPS, I know...), but the story was SO good it was a bummer to slow it down with the fighting and 2) there could have been some awesome puzzles that used the powers.

Okay and 3) season pass chapter 2 isn't out yet... but still...

I want more.

Metanarative discourse personifed with supersymetric string theory.
10/10

Das Spiel bietet neben der von Bioshock gewohnten düsteren Atmosphäre eine völlig neue Ebene des Spielgefühls an. Die Mechaniken sind dabei immernoch relativ gleich wie bei Bioshock I. Wirklich bemerkenswert ist die Welt in die sich der Spieler entführen lassen kann und die Geschichte die während der Reise von Mr. DeWitt erzählt wird.
This is the best story game that I've played in a long time. 10/10 Would recommend

Jogo absurdamente incrível. Muito bem desenhado, dublado, animado, usa e abusa de sombreamento volumétrico, dando um tom muito épico. História comovente e cheia de plot twist. Aproveitando que GTA V não lançou pra PC em 2013, esse com certeza vence a disputa, não há last of sei lá o que que destrone esta obra de arte. Se te consideras um jogador descente, este jogo é indispensável, vá por mim...
Good game, Nice story about 10 hours long finished in 2 days. Wish the DLC was cheaper
Fantastic, Creative and just a lot of fun to play. The ending was a bit meh but other than that one of the best games i have ever played.
Elizabeth <3

[b]A lighthouse, a cryptic message, and an impossible city. The stage is set for another adventure through the grim, but surprisingly sunny, world of Bioshock. [/b]

The original [i]Bioshock[/i] is a landmark in immersive videogame narrative and incredible design. It combined wonderfully designed aestethics with cool gameplay elements and a nice story to boot. For those who were truly interested there was plenty of room to explore and learn more of the fallen city of Rapture. [i]Infinite[/i] then had a lot to live up to.

[i]Infinite[/i] takes you to the flying city of Columbia, a seceded state from early America that left the blasphemous world below behind to ascend to a plane closer to god. You're former private eye with a checkered past who is hired to retrieve a girl from this flying utopia. How hard can it be?

Plenty hard. As it turns out, you're expected, and they're not happy. [i]Inifite[/i] has you duke it out in the streets of Columbia while listening to the zealous chants of radical prophets and out of control rebels. The atmosphere is piled on at every turn and the game spares no expense to show you new and crazier things than you held possible. It is an exercise in world building of the highest order that adresses social, racial and religious themes to make you, the player, contemplate your actions and you make your way through the game. 

However, for all the grandeur and splendor found in its presentation, the execution leaves something to be desired. Do not misunderstand, the story unfolds perfectly and you're still given room to explore. The problem is in the gameplay. [i]Infinite[/i] borrows much of its combat from the original [i]Bioshock[/i], but trims away a lot of the fat and only leaves a bare bones set of options. Most battles revolve around bullet pumping and a bit of power flailing, while the combat systems in [i]Bioshock 2[/i] introduced so many cool things. This is [i]Infinite's[/i] main problem. After a few hours, the sun doesn't shine so bright anymore while you stride into another gunfight. 

Luckily, [i]Infinite[/i] spares no expense to keep the pace up so you can make your way through the story at a proper pace. This makes it a game to be enjoyed for its content, while it skimps a bit on the gameplay. That said, if you fancy yourself a masochist, feel free to dive into the 1999 mode. A super hard mode that leaves you reeling if you don't prepare. That'll keep you occupied for a while. Still, [i]Bioshock Infinite[/i] is an experience you will need to try at least once.

Pelaamisen arvoinen yksinpeli joka tarjoaa viihdyttävän katsauksen erillaiseen historiaan, missä rotuerottelu ja vanhurskaus on arkipäivää. Loppuun asti viihdyttävä teos ja mielestäni pelin lopetus ei tavanomaisesti lässähdä vaan tarjoaa mukavan pienen "mindfuck" hetken jota voi itsekseen naureskella ja mehustella pelin päättämisen jälkeen.

This one of my favorite games. I happen to enjoy story over gameplay (which is counter intuitive, I know) so the slightly repetitive nature of the combat isn't too hard for me to overlook. The story is great, and each time you play it you realize something more.

— Мы там, где мы нужны.
— Мы нужны, где мы есть.


BioShock Infinite поражает воображение старым, дедовским способом — за счет богатого воображения его авторов, которым удалось создать по-настоящему захватывающую историю, наполненную яркими образами, запоминающимися персонажами и резкими сюжетными поворотами. Идея города в небесах выглядит еще менее правдоподобной, чем идея города на океанском дне, но в этот заоблачный «диснейленд» веришь практически сразу и безоговорочно. Совокупность мелких, тщательно продуманных деталей, изящная экспозиция и в особенности то, как быстро этот диснейленд превращается в гитлерюгенд — конечно, в антиутопию куда проще поверить, чем в утопию.
gg you should get it
